holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year’s Day, on January 1, is the first day of the year and a public holiday in Poland.

holidays.name: Epiphany
holidays.description: Epiphany, also known as the Procession of the Three Kings, is annually celebrated as a public holiday in Poland on January 6.

holidays.name: Valentine's Day
holidays.description: Valentine’s Day (Walentynki) is one of the most romantic days of the year celebrated in many countries including Poland on February 14.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: Good Friday is observed in many churches in Poland to remember Jesus Christ’s death on the cross.

holidays.name: Holy Saturday
holidays.description: Holy Saturday, which is the day before Easter Sunday, is observed in many parts of Poland.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Easter Sunday is a public holiday in Poland to celebrate Jesus Christ’s resurrection.

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday, the day after Easter Sunday, is a public holiday in Poland. Both days celebrate Jesus Christ’s resurrection from the dead.

holidays.name: Labor Day / May Day
holidays.description: Labor Day (Święto Pracy), also known as May 1 (1 Maja), is a national public holiday in Poland every year.

holidays.name: Constitution Day
holidays.description: Constitution Day is an annual public holiday in Poland on May 3.

holidays.name: Mother's Day
holidays.description: Mother’s Day is celebrated in Poland on May 26 each year.

holidays.name: Whit Sunday
holidays.description: Whit Sunday, also known as Pentecost or the Descent of the Holy Spirit (Zeslanie Ducha Swietego) is an annual public holiday in Poland 7 weeks after Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Corpus Christi
holidays.description: Corpus Christi is an annual public holiday in Poland on the Thursday of the ninth week after Easter.

holidays.name: Father's Day
holidays.description: Father’s Day (Dzień Ojca) is celebrated in Poland on June 23 every year.

holidays.name: Assumption of Mary
holidays.description: The Day of Assumption, also known as the Miracle upon the Vistula, is a national holiday in Poland on August 15 each year.

holidays.name: All Saints' Day
holidays.description: All Saints’ Day is a public holiday in Poland on November 1 each year.

holidays.name: Independence Day
holidays.description: National Independence Day is an annual public holiday in Poland on November 11 to commemorate the country’s independence in 1918.

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve is celebrated as a festive occasion in Poland on December 24.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Christmas Day is a public holiday in Poland on December 25 each year.

holidays.name: Second Day of Christmas
holidays.description: Boxing Day, also known as St Stephen’s Day or Holy Szczepan, is a public holiday in Poland on December 26 each year.

holidays.name: New Year's Eve
holidays.description: Many people in Poland celebrate New Year’s Eve, which is the last day of the year in the Gregorian calendar, on December 31.
